name: Carson Elmore
text: The student performances are always great. It's a great space for enjoying theater. Try to be at least 30 minutes early, though, or they will re-sell your reserved tickets.

name: Jeremiah Dawson '
text: Good memories.  :)

name: Irene Golson
text: I have enjoyed attending several of this group's plays. I guarantee you will enjoy many laughs at any performance you choose. Food is always tasty and FREE wine all night long will definitely make you smile.

name: Rendie Smith
text: We had a blast!! Can't wait till next month.

name: clang theo
text: An amazing community theater offering instruction in the arts to students of all ages. Flexible class dates and very reasonable pricing.  The monthly shows are also not to be missed. A true treasure for Choctaw County and the surround area.

name: tonya singleton
text: Store is always in disarray.   Floors need mopping and checking out you always have to wait on cashier.  There is usually only one register open and a line halfway down the store

name: Akshay Ahuja
text: The venue is easy to get to and the staff of the BTL always provide First Class service. They always look to make individual or group feel special. Love coming here!

resp.text: Thank You so much for the wonderful review and the 5 stars. We love having you come see our shows.

name: Scott Seeley
text:
Top shelf productions. We're lucky to enjoy the quality productions BTL bring to Huntsville.

The staff in the office are very helpful and by stopping in  you save a few dollars per ticket, plus you get real good old tickets - no need to print at home.

Easy parking in front of the VBC box office the enter, turn right and head to the end of the hall.

Plus you'll get to see one of Huntsville's best art displays along the hallway. They rotate the display fairly often.

resp.text: Thank You very much for the wonderful review. It was great seeing you in the office the other day getting tickets. We love when people stop by, and having good old fashioned tickets is a great thing.

name: Robert Dornbos
text: Easy access. Some stairs required to get to your seats (no bad seats in the theatre). Friendly, helpful ushers. Food and drinks can be purchased at concession area and brought into theatre. Cellphones turned off  is a requirement during the show. Good shows during the season with local talent.

resp.text: Thanks for coming out, and Thanks for the great review.

name: M L
text: Just saw KINKY BOOTS. The show was first rate, but the orchestra is TOO LOUD! I don't think I heard or understood HALF of what was sung. Please fix this. It's a lot of money to only hear half of the show.

resp.text: Thank You  for the rating and the feedback. We take great care to ensure a good experience for everyone, but unfortunately the sound is in control of the particular shows themselves and not BTL staff. We do strive to make sure the shows under the audio situation.

name: Leslie Griffin
text:
Three Stars.... We are first time season ticket holders, and though there isn't a bad seat in the house, I agree with many other reviewers that the sound is a serious problem that will likely deter us from buying season tickets again.  The orchestra is lovely, but it is incredibly difficult to understand the dialogue or words to songs.  Regardless of whose responsibility it is, it seems to be a universal complaint that warrants attention.

UPDATED to FIVE STARS: 03/10/2019 --  Attended the Carole King "Beautiful" production, and it was FANTASTIC! -- The sound adjustments made for this show made it the most enjoyable experience we have had this season!  Way to go!

resp.text:
Thank You very much for your feedback, we hate to hear that you will not be joining us again. We have heard the complaints about the audio and do take it very seriously. In fact we take it so seriously that we communicate the past complaints with shows prior to their arrival now. All of that being said, BTL nor the VBC has any control of a show and how they perform their show. With any complaints about a shows audio, we have audio techs from the VBC try to help them solve the issue, but that does not always happen. From that, all I can do is apologize that you had a less than wonderful experience at the show. We do wish that there was more that we could do because the biggest reason we do this job is to help people have a good time, and really do not like when people don’t. So again, I do apologize for any show’s less than stellar handling of the audio issues.
Thank You for upping your review after seeing BEAUTIFUL The Carole King Musical. It was a fantastic show.

name: Judy Myers
text: Saw Celtic Woman.  No one shud miss this opportunity to see these talented women.  Huntsville Broadway Theater League is a fantastic stage for this show.

resp.text: Thank You for the great review!

name: Martin Dean
text: Top notch shows,  love it all.  The balcony has great seats but the sound is poor.

resp.text: Thank You so much for the review, we are constantly taking steps with each individual show to provide the best in the business, and we are always trying to make it better.

Fantastic sound and acoustics

text: Best gym I've ever trained in...and I've trained in a lot of gyms across the country. Wilmore's 24/7 fitness is the Valhalla of all types of strength and fitness sports! When it was a theater is was awesome too. Saw Travis Tritt there. BEST CONCERT EVER!

name: Keith Mitchell
text: The venue is small but great for seeing a band. The acoustics and sound were excellent. I would definitely go back. Biggest complaint was that the beer selection was horrible. Your choices were Bud Light, Michelob Ultra, Coors Light and Miller Light. There is a craft brewery in the area and they didn't even have anything by them available. That is ridiculous.

name: Jim Ostrosky
text: Jazz Hall Radio formerly WVSU has significantly changed it's "Smooth Jazz" programing to a blend of classical jazz with some Smooth Jazz mixed in. At least when the Tuxedo Junction hour was scheduled you knew what was coming so you could listen to this type of Jazz or change the station. Then,  You could later switch back when 'Smooth Jazz' was back on. After many years of listening to WVSU I'm sorry to see them morph to blended genres of Jazz. Oh, well there's always the 'Serious Jazz Radio'option.

text: Absolutely the best youth theater in Mobile Alabama! Everyone is just like a family there. No behind the scene drama or ugliness. name: Ultreya Park
text: Fantastic shows. Top-notch acting classes. Best kept news in Mobile. Beloved stories told through expert training, costuming, set design, lighting and make-up. Experienced professionals are directing and producing here. Full-time pursuits, not just locals with a passion (not that there's anything wrong with that). Broadway-style quality. Repertory equals reliable quality, a familiarity with all aspects of putting on rotating musicals and plays. Shows are also added anew. Original music is sprinkled in. If you haven't seen a show here, you will be thrilled. If you have, "get season tickets." Great place for kids to learn the craft of stage acting, backstage skills and be a part of something bigger than themselves. A second home for growth and happiness. Each season offers a "teen Halloween show," a holiday selection where the venue is the Saenger Theater downtown, a Shakespeare selection, a kids' musical, plus summer stock musicals. "The Conclusion of Edgar Allen Poe," "A Christmas Carol," "A Midsumer Night's Dream," and "Mary Poppins" are among the offerings in recent years. Plenty of adjacent parking. Great place to unwind and escape. A gem in the community. Favorite place for live entertainment. Go here and do this.

text: If you haven't seen one if their plays, then you are definitely in for a very pleasant surprise. Clue the Musical is the play I went to.  I cannot wait for their new one coming in December. name: Mary Hales-Ward
text:
Such an amazing night of Sisters and theatre last night. A stop at SweetCreek Farm Market for the most beautiful tomatoes and strawberries, followed by phenomenal acting by the cast and crew of Prattville's Way Off Broadway Theatre, in the presentation of Pride and Prejudice. If you haven’t visited the theatre that treats you like family, and always puts on a great show, you need to plan to go soon and often. You will never be disappointed. Such a joy to watch this classic play, directed by Pamela Trammell, and starring a brilliant cast and crew, fantastic wardrobe ensemble, and friendliest of support staff.
We love our family at WOBT!
Can’t wait for Oklahoma!!!❤️

name: Carolyn Sullivan
text: No other venue like this. I love it. Intimate, friendly and the seating is NOT CROWDED which my arthritic knees appreciate. Ms Pam always greets us with a welcoming joy. I’ve laughed and cried there. Can’t say enough about it!

name: Gonzalo Gurmendi
text: An artistic gem. Over 42 years of uninterrupted high quality theatre. I discovered the space in the late 1980s and have come back year after year to enjoy extraordinary productions. Countless actors, directors, set and light designers have shared their talent with our community. A place we all should treasure, support and cherish.

name: Brandon McCray
text: The best live theatre in Birmingham !!!

name: Blake Tanner
text:
BFT is my home away from home. I’ve seen countless shows here, and I’ve been on stage for most of them!

The space is intimate and cozy; it welcomes you in like an old friend welcoming you back to your hometown after you’ve been living in the big city for too long.

BFT always puts on productions full of meaning that always leaves one with a tear in their eyes, or a smile on their face.

name: Pamela York
text: Loved all of it. Great theater. Great performance. Saw a local group present "Choir Boy"; it is the first for "Choir Boy" which is still on Broadway. Absolutely Awesome!!! BBRTC & BFT, by Tarell Alvin McCraney.

text:
Nice evening. Play was entertaining. A murder mystery with lots of local flavor stirred in
Building is a bit dated. But what good theater isn't.

name: Ultreya Park
text: Love live theater! A fun time was had by all. Important, charming, well-supported community theater with live musical accompaniment. (For musicals only?) A great evening out which pairs well with a visit to the new waterfront grill around on highway 43. Theater doesn't  appear to ever repeat shows, which is catchy, but lose a little without benefit of adding shows to a repertoire (and then continually refine) to gain value of experience with production over time. Website offers no explanation of CURRENT directorship or "staff," but gather these differ from show to show. Likely necessary to keep going. Floors need good regular cleaning. Refreshments are homestyle quaint. Lottery-style offering of limited # of lesser expensive tickets ($5-7?) for select shows would broaden audience. Promote them to people in the surrounding neighborhoods especially. Keep on keeping on!

name: R J
text: Small town. Big talent. Been here for several performances. No not every actor is Broadway caliber but whatever they might lack in talent they make up for with enthusiasm and it's always fun. Give it a try!

name: dhelpfulhands
text: Visited this place to see 3CP Improv Comedy. We had a great time. It was good clean fun and family-oriented. It was a little hard to find because I'm not familiar with the area. We got a good parking spot and it was easy to get out once the event was over. I will be checking this place out to see what other events that they are going to host. I will also be looking at 3CP again because I enjoyed them!

name: Suzanne Coleman
text: Wonderful little theater. But wish you could pick your seats ahead of time.

name: the hj gang
text: It is so cool and nice I love this place

name: don rimmer
text: Had a great time watching guys and Dolls pretty funny you had a good plot and characters were really exciting

name: Gena Berchtold
text: Experienced the beautiful performance of The Little Mermaid.  The cast members were extremely talented. Performance and musical direction were outstanding and very professional.  This is a must see.

name: Ellen Carter
text: This is community theater. It's not professional but they try really hard. And they let people try being a director and stuff, so that's nice too.

name: Freda Mabry
text:
I just love all of the shows. Professional and very talented group of actors and actresses.
You can tell they put in 100% and work very hard.

name: Ken Sullivan
text: may have been the best outing we've ever made to chickasaw. great selection.

name: George Sirmon
text: Absolutely awesome singers, dancers musicians,  and scenes! Very entertaining!

name: Peniswhipes
text: Great plays, amazing service,  nice staff,  this is just a overall amazing place!

name: Alvin King
text: I thought it was one of the best one I've seen in 25 years.

name: Frances Bouler
text: My Fair Lady!  Great singing.  Great acting

name: Patricia Hacker
text: Alway a quality show!

name: Victoria Goodwin
text: The bathrooms were clean, the show was fantastic, and the theater was actually air conditioned.

name: Stacey Steiner
text: Great show. Couldn't believe how many were in the cast and how great they all did.

name: John Howat
text: I love All The Plays At Chickasaw Civic Theater Broadway Has Nothing On Them !!!!!! <3 <3 <3

name: Ligaya Gapud
text: I love doing shows here and the overall simplistic aesthetic of the building. It's a little run down, but it's home to so many actors and actresses and musicians

name: susan vinson
text: Great place to take the whole family!

name: Mark Mossa
text: Fun production of Joseph! Put a lot of work into it!

name: Kathy Roberts
text: The little theater that could and does the best!!

name: TJ Soul
text: Roomy yet cozy

name: John Howat
text: went to watch 1984 Very good play Enjoyed it Very much !!!!!

text: Great too watch

text: was just wonderful .  Thats enough

text: Police patrol

name: Billy McLeod
text: small facility. seats are ok. mics and lites  work well. an asset to our community!

name: Stephanie Melton
text:
Great cast in the play! The outside seating area is delightful. The people are very warm and welcoming.
Go see a play! Way better than T.V.

name: Quite Marvelous
text: As always, phenomenal!

name: Stacey Steiner
text:
I got my wires crossed. I thought have they were having a matinee of Rocky Horror Show. I knew it was coming up. I am used to JJP and Chickasaw. I had tried to buy tickets online last night. I got there a few minutes before 1:00 and waited until someone showed up to find out they aren't open on Sundays.

At least now I know why I haven't been there in a while! My fault, not theirs but I really enjoy Sunday matinees!

name: JR H
text: It was sold out on the last showing here so I did not choose to stay. But the local actors, directors and others do a great job here. I missed seeing a Steven Sondheim play here that must have been very well done since it sold out on the last show.

name: Candace Foster
text: The best theatre around! Dark & intimate, like a black box theatre. I love the mysterious vibe & the variety of shows put on. A theatre for all--especially if you're tired of the same old thing. Also, an awesome date night venue!

name: Sarah Parks
text: We really enjoyed the play. Just wasn't a good atmosphere for small children.  They serve alcohol and the workers where all drinking .

name: Lethel Brown
text: Nice and friendly peoples love this place

name: Aundrea Couchcrowley
text: The cast was superb in this 4 person play!

name: Marshall Mears
text: Best time. Comfort.

name: Bill Marinello
text: Never went

name: Kim Miller
text: Awesome

name: susan vinson
text: My favorite theatre in Mobile!

name: Steve Pennington
text: Wonderful place to see shows and hear great music. Family friendly and comfortable with a sweet staff.

name: Larry Caffee
text: Great place! Seating was great. Not a bad seat in the house. Play was a good quality and I would definitely go back! If you're looking for a small town amature theater this is your place!

name: Richard Vick
text: Hometown feel, you will love the local talent that is on display. Everyone is very nice and friendly. What more could you expect from a proper southern small town.

name: Greg Sewell
text: A great little theatre that tries. You will find something that you will enjoy as local talent brings the small stage life.

name: Daniel Arledge
text: It's a fun place to see a show..... great atmosphere and great talent is show cased in their shows. I've seen a total of 15 show all of them were A+ shows. It's great small hidden a little gem with great local talent, I'm glad to have found this.

resp.text: Thank you for supporting your community theater!

name: Nelda Faulkner
text: Had a great afternoon spending time with some amazing artist, very nice.

name: Octavia Kuransky
text: Professional community theater. Confident directing on the the part of Sue Ellen Wilkens. Eclectic selection of productions. Comfortable and convenient. Will return.

name: Vann Cook
text: Nice community theater. Small and cozy.

name: Michael Garrett
text: Wonderful place, they have art shows, stage plays, and other live entertainment. The facility is well maintained and is a great addition to downtown Leeds, helps give the City a charming arts venue.

name: Jan Short
text: Leed's Art Council is a great place to observe local talent. "The Father of the Bride" was a wonderful play. The characters were full of life and personality. The Hunchback of Notre Dame was an 'on the edge of your seat' type of production. Amazing talent!

name: thelastmohawkin
text: Was published in their journal; they had a great reception and reading for the contributors!

name: sharon hardy
text: Had a great time watching 3 on a String

name: Tammy Harris
text: I am so proud of my Aunt Emma, I really enjoyed the art pieces.

name: Patricia May Foster
text: The director was incredible and patient with us newbies

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Connie Lochamy
text: Enjoy watching the best plays.

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Peggy De La Torres
text: Wonderful acting and enjoy the show ,musical very very much.

name: James Carroll
text: Every town needs a place like this. Somewhere that the Arts can thrive.

name: Joanne Bruno
text: Love the venue and the play

name: Lesleigh Bolton
text: Wonderful place to see a play or an art show

name: Patsy Rea
text: Wonderful performance.

name: Regina Kellenberger
text: Loved the pictures on display!

name: Suzi V
text: Had great time. We saw Willy Wonka.

name: Don Frederick
text: Love the shows great addition to Leeds.

resp.text: Thanks!  We like to provide a variety of entertainment.

text: Talented actors and musicians!

name: Anne Jones
text: Heavy Hitters Intercessor Arise Conference sponsored by Proverbs 31 Women! Pastor Darious Fowler & his wife! My God the SPIRIT of the LORD filled the HOUSE! Deliverance! Had a wonderful time!

name: Greg Williams
text: Great venue. Don't miss it.
